name: Rhythms On The Rocks
address: 112-16 Rockaway Beach Blvd, Far Rockaway, NY 11694, USA

reviews.text: Wasn‚Äôt open at 3pm on a Saturday which was disappointing

Following a prior unsatisfactory experience, this visit presented several challenges. Specifically, there were issues with the presence of flies, impacting the dining experience.

Furthermore, the frozen strawberry daiquiri lacked the expected flavor profile, suggesting potential deviations from the established recipe. The quality of the food was inconsistent, with the rice being undercooked while the oxtail, though flavorful, was somewhat fatty.

Despite the limited number of patrons, the owner's engagement was minimal, and the overall experience raises concerns about future patronage.

Came upon this quaint establishment after a day of waking and touring Rockaway and thoroughly enjoyed my experience here.
From the appetizer sampler, rhythms pasta, jerk chicken, red snapper, rice and peas and fried plantains, everything was authentic and delicious.
Chef Devon came by and made sure everything was exceptional.
Truly a top notch dinner, can‚Äôt wait to come back

Delicious food, great atmosphere. This place has really got it all together with fun bands like The Knobs, great food and yummy drinks. The gracious hostess Fallon was so cheerful and welcoming! Love it!
This family-run restaurant has a great heart and even better food.  With a fantastic space for musical performances in the back,  dedicated staff, and amazing food, you can't go wrong.
Very nice for dinner or just to chill and have a drink
The customer service was great. The food was really good oxtail thumbs up..üëçüèæ

Went on a relatively slow night . Took very long to get our food . One person was waiting 15 mins extra for their meal. Asked for a side of sauce never came out until almost done with meal. Then there was a promotion for $10 for using google pay which i did and when asked even the owner couldn't tell me how it works . This was the second time with service issue . The only positive is the food was decent .

Welcoming establishment, with great cocktails, food and service. Standout dishes include shrimp tacos, calamari, shrimp scampi, and grilled halibut with rice and peas. We've been here a few times since it's opening, and will be returning soon.
The food was fantastic! So happy to have such a high-quality seafood restaurant close by.

Last weekend, I had the pleasure of visiting Rhythms on the Rock with my family, and it was truly a delightful experience. From the moment we arrived, the vibrant atmosphere set the tone for what would be a memorable meal.

We started with the jerk chicken wings, and they were simply out of this world! Cooked to perfection, the wings were infused with a wet jerk sauce that enhanced their flavor beautifully. Each bite was a burst of deliciousness that left us wanting more.

Next up was the pepper shrimp, saut√©ed in traditional Jamaican seasonings. The dish was a celebration of flavors, featuring scotch bonnet, shallots, garlic, and fresh thyme. It was incredibly satisfying and truly embodied the essence of island cuisine. We also enjoyed some lightly fried fish  nestled in warm tortillas, topped with crispy slaw, a creamy sauce, and a hint of lime for that perfect balance.

For a lighter option, the burrata salad was a standout. Creamy burrata served over a bed of fresh mixed greens and vine-ripened tomatoes, drizzled with olive oil and balsamic glaze ‚Äì it was refreshing and delicious.

We couldn‚Äôt resist trying the grilled salmon and the tasty grilled lobster, both of which were cooked to perfection and added to the delightful experience.

To wash it all down, we enjoyed some creative cocktails. The Miami Vice, a blend of rum, pineapple juice, coconut cr√®me, strawberry slush, and lime, was a fruity delight. The frozen watermelon mojito, made with watermelon, lime juice, white rum, seltzer, and fresh mint, was incredibly refreshing and the ideal way to complement our meal.

Overall, Rhythms on the Rock exceeded our expectations with its fantastic food, vibrant atmosphere, and friendly service. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for great food!

Devon is a humble owner who talked to me about himself and his restaurant. Opened in February of 2025, he is doing well so far. On weekends, they have live music dining. The place is clean, the food good, and he even has a food truck to sell at the boardwalk to draw attention to his main brick and mortar. They have plenty of vegetarian options such as fish or simply no animal dishes. I had the Jerk Burger sliders, and it was deeelish. The burgers were so juicy, and sauce is one thing that usually gets refrigerated again and again, but the sauce was fresh and had no hint of refrigeration flavor. If you ever stop by Far Rockaway Beach, be sure to stop by here. There will be plenty of seating options both indoor and outdoor for you. There is also two person dining for a romantic night for you and your S.O.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Rhythms on the Rocks: A Caribbean Culinary Masterpiece!
From the moment you step into Rhythms on the Rocks, you're not just entering a restaurant; you're embarking on a vibrant journey to the heart of the Caribbean. This place is an absolute gem, delivering an unforgettable dining experience that tantalizes every sense.

The ambiance is simply captivating ‚Äì a perfect blend of lively island music, warm lighting, and decor that instantly transports you to a tropical paradise. But let's talk about the food, because that's where Rhythms on the Rocks truly shines.

Every dish we sampled was a testament to authentic Caribbean flavors, prepared with passion and precision. The Jerk Chicken was a revelation: perfectly spiced, incredibly tender, and bursting with that signature smoky, fiery kick. It was so good, it practically melted in my mouth.

And don't even get me started on the sides! The Rice and Peas were fluffy and flavorful, the Plantains sweet to perfection

The service was impeccable ‚Äì attentive, friendly, and genuinely enthusiastic. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu, offered excellent recommendations, and ensured our glasses were never empty.

Rhythms on the Rocks isn't just a meal; it's an experience. It's the kind of place where you feel the rhythm, taste the sunshine, and leave with a full belly and a happy heart. If you're craving truly authentic Caribbean cuisine in an incredible setting, look no further. This is, without a doubt, a five-star culinary destination!

Food sucks save your money . Over price and taste like horrible . I don‚Äôt know where they learned how to cook Jamaican food but this is not it. Seems like the chef needs a new set of taste buds . Tried them based off a instagram posting . Your Instagram is a liar !!!!
Good food, good portion and overall good vibes. Staff was lovely.

I have gone for brunch and dinner several times and each time is better than the last. Flavorful food, great ambiance, pleasant/friendly staff(which is a dime a dozen these days).. and a block away from the beach! A new summer gem for sure!

Love this place! Been there twice now. Each time so far food was delicious, drinks were well made and the service provided by the bartender/server Ro was excellent. I haven't had a chance to experience the musical offerings yet but plan to return so I can.
Came here on a recommendation. Food was fresh and  delicious, friendly customer service.
Went for dinner last night. Food and service were excellent. The owner and waiter were very friendly. It‚Äôs a great addition to Rockaway.
We had a wonderful experience here. The food was excellent and the drinks were as well.. We had the jerk chicken sliders, grilled octopus, and lobster dip as starters. We will definitely be back.
A great addition to the Rockaway‚Äôs. Staff, Food, cocktails and service were excellent.
